review_title: I had great time working in The Ai of vancouver .. great creative atmosphere potential for growth with in company.
pros: Great workplace with very creative students , joy for any instructor in creative career. Feels like team work . Forward thinking company.
cons: Very structured working hours and administration . Has a lot of prepping for the class while you are payed just for teaching hours .

pros:
All Group are professional
Kind 
Organize 
Understand us
cons:
Less salary 
No bones 
No off 
Management

pros: Good team, good hours and flexible
cons: You had to read from a script

pros: The other employee's are helpful souls and nice people work.  Also, the benefit of working here is to be of help to the students who want skills and personal development,  I find this area quite rewarding, but the management team uses their staff in a bad way.
cons: No trust with management.  I was laid off and then re-hired the next day.... what do you think my motivation was like after this treatment?  I saw our staff being 'used' by management without regards to the impact to their students who pay big money for the program but behind the scenes its like the Wizard of Oz - all smoke and mirrors.  I was sad I ever wasted my time and worked here.

pros:
Worked collaboratively with other departments
Open to new ideas
Fulfilling work - working with students, helping them achieve their goals
cons: Terrible direct manager - no experience, did things the hard way, didn't like me, but didn't know why - gave up on trying to fix this/figure out why

job_title: Assistant Director of Admissions in Vancouver, BC
pros: So disillusioned that I can't think of any.
cons: I have been working with this company for approx. 4 years and was fired. There has been a merger with LCI (La Salle College) and probably that was the reason. However, this is no way to treat your employees, who have responsibilities and bills to pay. It's high handed, dismissive and certainly not the place to build dreams or hopes of being treated decently by management.

review_title: a satisfying experience with low-motivated youth.
pros: Very friendly and professional staff, good network support. Free croissants and coffee for the first week of each quarter.
cons: Many students are passive for discussions and concern only with their hobbies.
